sense.name: a person who exemplifies a characteristic or state
sense.examples: Sally is the personification of optimism. Tom's grandfather was the very personification of British pluck and diplomacy. Note: refers to a person whose role is to serve as an example of some trait or situation

sense.name: a human form that represents an abstraction
sense.commentary: PERSONIFICATION[+entity][+form][+symbolic][+human][+representative][-visual_abstraction] Note: refers to a human form (not a real person) that represents a non-visual abstraction
sense.examples: The design of the franc shows Marianne, who is the personification of the French Republic. This figure of a strong young woman is the personification of Liberty. The figures in the foreground of the painting are the personifications of the seven deadly sins.

sense.name: the act of assigning human traits to an abstraction
sense.commentary: PERSONIFICATION[+activity][+creation][+concretizing][+humanizing][-visual_abstraction] Note: refers to an agent's creation of a humanized manifestation of a non-visual abstraction. Note: Senses 1 and 2 do not imply the role of an agent, as does Sense 3
sense.examples: What does the poet intend with his personification of the dawn? The writer's personification of the young drifter as Death was too obvious a ploy for the critics.
